DOC.detailed_description: PROTOCOL SUMMARY Title : Transition Ferric Citrate among Hemodialysis Peritoneal Dialysis Patients : A Phase 4 `` Real World '' Experience Study Kaiser Permanente Southern California Short Title : FeCitrate Protocol Number : KP FeCitrate Study Phase : 4 Study Site ( ) : Los Angeles Kaiser Sunset Medical Center Number Subjects : 55 Study Arms : 1 Indication : Hyperphosphatemia end stage renal disease Primary Purpose : To evaluate efficacy ferric citrate control serum phosphorus level maintenance adequate iron store among dialysis-dependent patient conversion traditional phosphate binder `` real world '' environment Overview Study Design : Prospective non-randomized cohort study 6-9 month duration ( active study period 6 month ) . Investigational Product Administration : One two tablet Ferric Citrate phosphorus binder administer mouth every meal prevent dietary phosphorus absorption . Study Endpoint : Mean serum phosphorus level rate successful phosphorus control ( < 5.5mg/dl ) 6 month treatment ferric citrate Statistical Methods : Not power detect statistical significance
